tit.cmt: 以下、天皇名、人名の読み方は、ブリタニカ国際大百科事典、広辞苑、kotobank.jpで確認

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇（さがてんのう、延暦5年9月7日（786年10月3日） - 承和9年7月15日（842年8月24日））は、日本の第52代天皇（在位：大同4年4月1日（809年5月8日） - 弘仁14年4月16日（823年5月29日））。
sen.e: Emperor Saga (October 3rd, 786 - August 24th, 842) was the 52nd Emperor. (His reign was May 8th, 809 - May 29th, 823)
Emperor Saga (October 3, 786 - August 24, 842) was the fifty-second Emperor (his reign lasted from May 8, 809 to May 29, 823).
Emperor Saga (October 3, 786 - August 24, 842) was the fifty-second Emperor (his reign lasted from May 8, 809 to May 29, 823).

sen.j: 名は神野（かみの）。
sen.e: His first name was Kamino.
His first name was Kamino.
His first name was Kamino.

sen.j: 桓武天皇の第二皇子で、母は皇后藤原乙牟漏。
sen.e: Emperor SAGA was the second prince of Emperor KANMU and his mother was Empress FUJIWAEA no Otomuro.
sen.cmt: 藤原乙牟漏 FUJIWARA no Otomuro
sen.e: Emperor SAGA was the second prince of Emperor KANMU, and his mother was Empress FUJIWAEA no Otomuro.
Emperor Saga was the second prince of Emperor Kammu, and his mother was Empress FUJIWARA no Otomuro.

sen.j: 同母兄に平城天皇。
sen.e: His half older brother was Emperor HEIZEI.
His older half-brother was Emperor HEIZEI.
His older half-brother was Emperor Heizei.

sen.j: 異母弟に淳和天皇他。
sen.e: His half younger brother was Emperor JUNNAI.
His younger half-brother was Emperor JUNNAI.
His younger half-brother was Emperor Junna.

sen.j: 皇后は橘嘉智子（檀林皇后）。
sen.e: The Empress was TACHIBANA no Kachiko. (Empress Danrin)
sen.cmt: 橘嘉智子（檀林皇后）TACHIBANA no Kachiko(Empress Danrin)
sen.e: The Empress was TACHIBANA no Kachiko (Empress Danrin).
The Empress was TACHIBANA no Kachiko (Empress Danrin).

tit.cmt: Biography→Brief Personal Historyに変更しました。

sen.j: 兄・平城天皇の即位に伴って皇太弟に立てられる。
sen.e: Emperor SAGA became second prince when his brother, Emperor HEIZEI was enthroned.
Emperor SAGA became the second prince when his brother, Emperor HEIZEI, was enthroned.
Emperor Saga became the second prince when his brother, Emperor Heizei, was enthroned.

sen.j: だが、平城天皇には既に高岳親王・阿保親王の両親王がいたことから、皇太弟擁立の背景には、亡父・桓武天皇の意向が働いたといわれている。
sen.e: However Emperor HEIZEI already had Prince TAKAOKA and Prince ABO, the background how Emperor SAGA became second Prince was due to his past away father, Emperor KANMU's intention.
sen.cmt: 高岳親王 Prince TAKAOKA, 阿保親王 Prince ABO
sen.e: However, Emperor HEIZEI already had Prince TAKAOKA and Prince ABO, so the means by which Emperor SAGA became second Prince was that his deceased father, Emperor KANMU, had intended it.
However, Emperor Heizei already had Prince Takaoka and Prince Abo, so the means by which Emperor Saga became the second prince was that his deceased father, Emperor Kammu, had intended it.

sen.j: このような事情から即位後に甥にあたる高岳親王を皇太子としたが、翌年810年に平城天皇が復位を試みた「薬子の変」が発生する。
sen.e: Due to above situation, Emperor SAGA's nephew, Prince TAKAOKA became Crown Prince after the Emperor's enthronement, one year later, there was "the Revolt of Kusuko" when Emperor HEIZEI tried to be restored to the throne in 810.
sen.cmt: 「薬子の変」the Revolt of Kusuko; the Kusuko Incident 研究社新和英大辞典
sen.e: Due to the above situation, Emperor SAGA's nephew, Prince TAKAOKA, became the crown prince after the Emperor's enthronement, and a year later there was "the Revolt of Kusuko" when Emperor HEIZEI tried to be restored to the throne in 810.

Given the above situation, Emperor Saga's nephew, Prince Takaoka, became the crown prince after the Emperor's enthronement, and a year later (810) there was "the Revolt of Kusuko," when Emperor Heizei attempted to regain the throne.

sen.j: この結果、高岳親王は廃されるが、実子を立てる事に気まずさを感じたためか今度はかねてから臣籍降下を望んでいた異母弟の大伴親王（淳和天皇）を強引に皇太弟に立ててしまった（これが承和の変の遠因となる）。
sen.e: After this incident Prince TAKAOKA lost his power, the Emperor felt guilty setting his own son up as a Crown Prince, Prince Otomo, his half brother became second prince who was willing to descent to leave the royal family. (This caused the Showa Incident indirectly.)
sen.cmt: 承和の変 Showa Incident 研究社新和英大辞典, 臣籍降下 discent to 定訳不明
sen.e: After this incident Prince TAKAOKA lost his power; the Emperor felt guilty for setting his own son up as the crown prince, Prince Otomo, but his half-brother became second prince who was willing to descend and leave the royal family (which was an indirect cause of the Showa Incident).

After this incident, Prince Takaoka lost power, and the Emperor felt guilty for having set his biological son up as the crown prince; Prince Otomo, his half-brother, became the second prince who was willing to descend and leave the royal family (which was an indirect cause of the Showa Incident).
sen.cmt: TAKAOKA→Takaokabut削除原文に合わせて修正。own son→biological sonに変更しました。

sen.j: ともあれ、以後表面上は平穏な治世を送り宮廷の文化が盛んな時期（弘仁文化）を過ごした。
sen.e: Apart from anything else, the culture inside the Imperial palace became very popular (the Konin culture) and the time passed in peace seemingly.
sen.cmt: 弘仁文化 the Konin culture 研究社新和英大辞典
sen.e: Apart from anything else, the culture within the Imperial Palace became very popular (the Konin culture), and seemingly the time passed in peace.

sen.j: 818年、弘仁格を発布して死刑を廃止した。
sen.e: The death penalty was abolished after issuing Konin Kyaku.
The death penalty was abolished following the issuance of the Konin Kyaku.
The death penalty was abolished following the issuance of the Konin Kyaku in 818.

sen.j: 中央政界における死刑の廃止は以後保元の乱まで347年間続く。
sen.e: The abolishment of death penalty in national political arena continued to the Hogen (civil) War for 347 years.
sen.cmt: 保元の乱 定訳不明保元の乱 Hogen (civil) War 定訳不明
sen.e: The abolishment of the death penalty in the national political arena continued for 347 years, up to the Hogen (civil) War.
The abolishment of the death penalty in the national political arena continued for 347 years, up to the Hogen (civil) War.

sen.j: だが、当時は農業生産が極度の不振（『日本後紀』によれば、817年より7年連続で干害などの被害を受けたとされている）にあり、その結果として当時財政難は深刻であった。
sen.e: However agricultural production was in a slump at that time, (according to Nihon Koki there was seven consecutive years of draught damage since 817.) due to this situation there was a serious financial difficulty problem.

However, agricultural production was in a slump at that time (according to "Nihon Koki" there were seven consecutive years of draught damage, beginning in 817), and due to this situation there was the problem of serious financial difficulty.

However, agricultural production was in a slump at that time (according to "Nihon Koki" there were seven consecutive years of draught damage, beginning in 817), and due to this situation there was the problem of serious financial difficulty.

sen.j: 820年には当時朝廷内で大きな権勢を誇っていた藤原氏の有力者4人（藤原内麻呂・藤原冬嗣親子、藤原緒嗣、藤原園人）が揃って封戸を返上（計15,000戸）している（更に緒嗣は淳和天皇時代の825年に2,000戸を追加返上した）。
sen.e: In 820 four key personalities from FUJIWARA clan of the Imperial Palace, (FUJIWARA no Uchimaro, FUJIWARA no Huyutsugu, FUJIWARA no Otsugu, FUJIWARA no Sonondo) sent Fuko (the a vassal household allotted to a courtierfeudal estate) back. (15,000 land in total) (Furthermore FUJIWARA no Otsugu sent 2,000 land back while Emperor JUNNA was in power in 825.)
sen.cmt: 藤原内麻呂 FUJIWARA no Uchimaro, 藤原冬嗣 FUJIWARA no Huyutsugu, 藤原緒嗣 FUJIWARA no Otsugu, 藤原園人 FUJIWARA no Sonondo
sen.e: In 820, four key personalities from the FUJIWARA clan of the Imperial Palace (FUJIWARA no Uchimaro, FUJIWARA no Huyutsugu, FUJIWARA no Otsugu and FUJIWARA no Sonondo) sent Fuko (a vassal household allotted to a courtier feudal estate) back (15,000 units of land in total) (furthermore, FUJIWARA no Otsugu sent 2,000 units of land back in 825, while Emperor JUNNA was in power).

In 820, four key personalities from the Fujiwara clan of the Imperial Palace (FUJIWARA no Uchimaro, FUJIWARA no Huyutsugu, FUJIWARA no Otsugu and FUJIWARA no Sonondo) sent Fuko (a vassal household allotted to a courtier feudal estate) back (15,000 units of land in total) (furthermore, FUJIWARA no Otsugu sent 2,000 units of land back in 825, while Emperor Junna was in power).

sen.j: また、最末期には大土地所有の制限を緩和して荒田開発を進め、公営田・勅旨田の設置などが行われている。
sen.e: At the end of this government the restriction towards latifundism was tempered and the wild field was developed, government own field (Kueiden) and the field directly own by the Emperor (Chokushi den) were established.
sen.cmt: 勅旨田 定訳不明。勅旨はan imperial order勅旨田 a vassal household allotted to a courtier 研究社新和英大辞典
sen.e: At the end of this government, the restriction toward latifundism was tempered and the wild fields were developed, while government-own fields (kueiden) and the fields directly owned by the Emperor (chokushi den) were established.

At the end of this government, the restriction toward latifundism was tempered and the wild fields were developed, while government-own fields (kueiden) and the fields directly owned by the Emperor (chokushi den) were established.

sen.j: 823年、財政上の問題を理由（上皇が2人では財政負担が大きい）に反対する藤原冬嗣の主張を押し切って大伴親王に譲位した。
sen.e: In 823 the Emperor SAGA step down from the throne and passed the position to Prince OTOMO although FUJIWARA no Otsugu's opposed this in relation to financial problems. (There was a too much financial burden to have two retired Emperors.)

In 823 Emperor SAGA step down from the throne and passed the position to Prince OTOMO, although FUJIWARA no Otsugu opposed this with respect to the financial problems (there was too great a financial burden to have two retired Emperors).

In 823 Emperor Saga stepped down from the throne and passed the position to Prince Otomo, although FUJIWARA no Otsugu opposed this with respect to the financial problems (there was too great a financial burden to have two retired emperors).

sen.j: 退位後は冷然院・嵯峨院を造営して財政を逼迫させただけでなく、実子正良親王（仁明天皇）が即位すると「皇室の長」として政治に干渉する場面も多くなり、更に淳和上皇や仁明天皇の反対を押し切って自分の外孫でもある淳和上皇の皇子恒貞親王を皇太子とするなど、朝廷内で絶大な権力を振るって後に様々な火種を残した。
sen.e: After the retirement, not only he ordered to build Reizen In and Saga In, which made the financial situation worse for the Imperial Palace, but also he interfered into the politics as the top of the palace after his son, Prince Masara (Emperor NINMYO) became Emperor, he also set Prince Tsunesada up as a Crown Prince, who was his grandchild and Emperor JUNNA's Prince,despite Emperor JUNNA and Emperor NINMYO's opposition, his autocratic style caused many problems in coming ages.
sen.cmt: Reizen In 冷然院, Saga In 嵯峨院, 正良親王 Prince Masara, 仁明天皇 the Emperor NINMYO, 恒貞親王 Prince Tsunesada
sen.e: After the retirement, not only did he order the construction of Reizen In and Saga In, which made the financial situation worse for the Imperial Palace, but he also interfered in politics as the top of the palace after his son, Prince Masara (Emperor NINMYO) became Emperor; moreover, he set Prince Tsunesada up as the crown prince, who was his grandchild and Emperor JUNNA's prince, despite Emperor JUNNA and Emperor NINMYO's opposition, so his autocratic style caused many problems in the subsequent years.

After the retirement, not only did he order the construction of Reizen In and Saga In, which made the financial situation worse for the Imperial Palace, but he also interfered in politics as the top of the palace after his biological son, Prince Masara (Emperor Ninmyo), became Emperor; moreover, despite the opposition of the emperors Junna and Ninmyo, he set Prince Tsunesada up as the crown prince, who was his grandchild and Emperor Junna's prince, so in subsequent years his autocratic style caused many problems.
sen.cmt: JUNNA→JunnaNINMYO→Ninmyohis son→his biological sonに変更しました。
